website_summaries.verdict: A nice pair of budget hi-hat cymbals that offer a bright sound to cut through instrument ensembles.
pros: Offers a great deal of durability to survive the abuse that comes with aggressive play styles found in rock, metal, and more
Can handle heavier wood and metal sticks
cons: Sound can come across as dull or lacking great volume and presence

customer_reviews.title: Sound good for the price but I wish they were b20 bronze...(which would probably take the price up though)
customer_reviews.text: Sound good for the money and the fact that they're brass cymbals. I am going to use some b20 bronze cymbals by Wuhan instead for recording. I wish I would have known that brass cymbals are for students, then I would have bought my other ones instead first for recording. But still I don't want to bash these(no pun intended) cause they sound good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Mezzetti

customer_reviews.title: May Be Fake
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware!! The cymbals I got look nothing like the picture in the item description. For all I know they may be totally fake SABIANs. PLUS there is no difference between the individual cymbals as usually a true Hi-Hat set has one cymbal thicker or heavier than the other. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: one or two of the reviews stated they sound dull; perhaps those people received duds
customer_reviews.text: this is the first i've heard of this line from sabian. i have yet to put em on my kit at church, but just from stick tests, they sound clear, bright, higher pitch than 14s ( which is why i bought them ). one or two of the reviews stated they sound dull; perhaps those people received duds, because mine ring out quite well, & that's just being lightly played with a pair of lightweight wooden tipped sticks. can't wait to get my 727 nylon tips on them. good job, sabian; keep them cheap.
customer_reviews.author: KodiakWildHolmes

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner cymbals
customer_reviews.text: My wife is learning the drums. These cymbals work perfectly well for her.
customer_reviews.author: The Radtkes

customer_reviews.title: Great and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: these hat cymbals sound excellent! especially for the price. they have a higher pitch to them than normal hats since they're 13" instead of the standard 14" hats, they resonate really really well and just have a beautiful brilliant sound to them. definitely worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband, and he definitely, notices the difference.
customer_reviews.author: celeste inman

customer_reviews.title: Pass on these.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is terrible. It has a really bad ring to it, not the nice clean "chick" you want.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Novice
customer_reviews.text: Great for novice. They sound decent and seem to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible sound.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible sound... whether you are playing closed or open the sound is flat and dull. I regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Maxvol61

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the hi-hat set and they are working just fine. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, if your expectations are realistic
customer_reviews.text: Great, if your expectations are realistic. I bought this as a birthday present for my 4/5 year old son who plays drums. This, along with a PDP hi-hat stand, is the perfect hi-hat for his mini drum set. This replaces the awful "child's" hi-hat that came with his drumset, so this is a HUGE step up. They would probably be too dark for a full size setup, and for someone who plays out in clubs or other live settings, but they're perfect for me and my son.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Honestly they sound terrible. Might be good for beginners who just want ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly they sound terrible. Might be good for beginners who just want to make noise. They really doesn’t make you feel like playing. :/ Returned them
customer_reviews.author: BIB

customer_reviews.title: They sound great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pro drummer. I bought these for a beginner. They sound great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not like
customer_reviews.text: I am not satisfied with the overall sound of the hi-hats. It has a dull hollow sound when tightened and a dull open sound. I bought them for the use of playing gospel music in church. They suffice when music is being played, giving a crisp sound. But when played singular the leave an ugly resonance. They sound better with thick wood sticks, I prefer nylon and this increases that dull resonant sound.
customer_reviews.author: Arkeem Sturgis

customer_reviews.title: They sound terrific!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves these hi hat cymbals. They sound terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Gregory

customer_reviews.title: sweet!!!!
customer_reviews.text: so much better than my old ones... heavy duty. well made. i destroyed my other ones in no time... i wont destroy these. very beautifull. i tried to destroy them yesterday, and didnt even come close.... i will have lots of years of drumming on these...
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Sabian is a great company and honestly if anyone has problems with hi hats it is more than likely the stand more than the cymbals. Plenty of drummers will get cymbals at a second hand store and make it sound great, it just depends on how you play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great and so was the price. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Midili

product_meta.title: Sabian SBR 13" Hi-Hat Cymbals
product_meta.description: Medium weight pairing delivers tight, clean sounds when closed, and loud fullness when open. SABIAN 13" SBr Hi-Hats are the best value in pure brass, ideal for beginners. With hammered and lathed surface, tightly focused sound and nice price, SBr is in a class of its own.
feature_bullets: Tight and clean when closed, loud and full when open
Smartly priced, SBr Brass is in a class of its own
SBr makes your first step into cymbals an easy one

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars52 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
